verses.verse: The word<WH1697> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> from the Lord<WH3068>, saying<WH559>,
Thus speaks<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, Write<WH3789> all the words<WH1697> that I have spoken<WH1696> unto you in a book<WH5612>.

For<WH3117>, behold, the days come<WH935>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068>, that I will bring again<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063>, says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>: and I will cause them to return<WH7725> to the land<WH776> that I gave<WH5414> to their fathers<WH1>, and they shall possess it<WH3423>.
And these are the words<WH1697> that the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> concerning Israel<WH3478> and concerning Judah<WH3063>.
For thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; We have heard<WH8085> a voice<WH6963> of trembling<WH2731>, of fear<WH6343>, and not of peace<WH7965>.

Ask<WH7592> you now<WH7200>, and see whether a man<WH2145> does give birth with child<WH3205>? Why do I see<WH7200> every man<WH1397> with his hands<WH3027> on his body<WH2504>, as a woman in hardship<WH3205>, and all faces<WH6440> are turned<WH2015> into paleness<WH3420>?
Alas<WH1945>! for that day<WH3117> is great<WH1419>, so that<WH369> none is like it<WH6256>: it is even the time of Jacob<WH3290>'s trouble<WH6869>; but he shall be saved out of it<WH3467>.

For it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, that I will break<WH7665> his yoke<WH5923> from off your neck<WH6677>, and will burst<WH5423> your bonds<WH4147>, and strangers<WH2114> shall no more make bondservants of him<WH5647>:
But they shall serve<WH5647> the Lord<WH3068> their God<WH430>, and David<WH1732> their king<WH4428>, whom I will raise up unto them<WH6965>.

Therefore fear<WH3372> not<WH5650>, O my servant Jacob<WH3290>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068>; neither be dismayed<WH2865>, O Israel<WH3478>: for<WH3467>, behold, I will save you from afar<WH7350>, and your seed<WH2233> from the land<WH776> of their captivity<WH7628>; and Jacob<WH3290> shall return<WH7725>, and shall be in rest<WH8252>, and be quiet<WH7599>, and none shall make him afraid<WH2729>.

For I am with you<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068>, to save<WH3467> you<WH6213>: though I make a full end<WH3617> of all nations<WH1471> where I have scattered<WH6327> you<WH6213>, yet will I not make a full end<WH3617> of you<WH3256>: but I will correct you in measure<WH4941>, and will not leave you altogether<WH5352> unpunished<WH5352>.
For thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, Your bruise<WH7667> is incurable<WH605>, and your wound<WH4347> is severe<WH2470>.
There is none to plead<WH1777> your cause<WH1779>, that you may be bound up<WH4205>: you have no healing<WH8585> medicines<WH7499>.

All your lovers<WH157> have forgotten<WH7911> you<WH1875>; they seek you not<WH5221>; for I have wounded you with the wound<WH4347> of a enemy<WH341>, with the chastisement<WH4148> of a cruel one<WH394>, for the multitude<WH7230> of your iniquity<WH5771>; because your sins<WH2403> were increased<WH6105>.

Why cry<WH2199> you for your affliction<WH7667>? your sorrow<WH4341> is incurable<WH605> for the multitude<WH7230> of your iniquity<WH5771>: because your sins<WH2403> were increased<WH6105>, I have done these things unto you<WH6213>.

Therefore all they that devour<WH398> you shall be devoured<WH398>; and all your adversaries<WH6862>, every one of them<WH3212>, shall go into captivity<WH7628>; and they that plunder<WH7601> you shall be a plunder<WH4933>, and all that prey<WH962> upon you will I give<WH5414> for a prey<WH957>.

For I will restore<WH5927> health<WH724> unto you<WH7495>, and I will heal you of your wounds<WH4347>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068>; because they called<WH7121> you a Outcast<WH5080>, saying<WH6726>, This is Zion, whom no man seeks after<WH1875>.

Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; Behold<WH7725>, I will bring again the captivity<WH7622> of Jacob<WH3290>'s tents<WH168>, and have mercy<WH7355> on his dwellingplaces<WH4908>; and the city<WH5892> shall be built<WH1129> upon her own heap<WH8510>, and the palace<WH759> shall remain<WH3427> after the manner there<WH4941>.

And out of them shall proceed<WH3318> thanksgiving<WH8426> and the voice<WH6963> of them that make merry<WH7832>: and I will multiply<WH7235> them<WH4591>, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify<WH3513> them<WH6819>, and they shall not be small.
Their sons<WH1121> also shall be as before<WH6924>, and their congregation<WH5712> shall be established<WH3559> before<WH6440> me<WH6485>, and I will punish all that oppress them<WH3905>.

And their nobles<WH117> shall be of themselves<WH4910>, and their governor shall proceed<WH3318> from the midst<WH7130> of them<WH7126>; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach<WH5066> unto me<WH6148>: for who is this that engaged his heart<WH3820> to approach<WH5066> unto me<WH5002>? says the Lord<WH3068>.
And you shall be my people<WH5971>, and I will be your God<WH430>.

Behold<WH5591>, the whirlwind of the Lord<WH3068> goes forth<WH3318> with fury<WH2534>, a continuing<WH1641> whirlwind<WH5591>: it shall fall with pain<WH2342> upon the head<WH7218> of the wicked<WH7563>.

The fierce<WH2740> anger<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> shall not return<WH7725>, until he have done<WH6213> it<WH6965>, and until he have performed the intents<WH4209> of his heart<WH3820>: in the latter<WH319> days<WH3117> you shall understand it<WH995>.
